text: Edna Mae Durbin, known as Deanna Durbin (December 4, 1921 - April 17, 2013),Date of death of Edna David per Social Security Death Index, search.ancestrylibrary.com; accessed April 11, 2018. was a Canadian actress and singer. She was in a number of musical movies in the 1930s and 1940s, singing standards and operatic arias. Her first movie was in 1936 with Judy Garland in Every Sunday. She was born in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada on December 4, 1921 but has lived near Paris since she married Charles David in 1950. Deanna Durbin' death was announced on April 30, 2013 in Paris, France from unknown causes, aged of 91. Deanna Durbin deceased on April 17,2013. ==References== == Other websites == * * * Category:1921 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Actors from Winnipeg Category:Canadian movie actors Category:Canadian singers Category:Canadian stage actors Category:Canadian television actors Category:Unexplained deaths
title: Deanna Durbin
